microkeras.layers.dense package

Submodules

microkeras.layers.dense.build module

microkeras.layers.dense.build.build(self, input_shape)[source]

Build the dense layer by initializing weights and biases.

This method initializes the weight matrix and bias vector for the dense layer based on the input shape and the number of units in the layer.

Parameters: input_shape (int or tuple): The shape of the input to this layer. If tuple, the first element is used.

Note: - Weights are initialized randomly in the range [-0.5, 0.5]. - Biases are initialized randomly in the range [-0.5, 0.5].

microkeras.layers.dense.copy module

microkeras.layers.dense.copy.copy(self)[source]

Create a deep copy of the dense layer.

This method creates a new instance of the dense layer with the same configuration and performs a deep copy of the weights and biases if they have been initialized.

Returns: Dense: A new Dense layer instance with copied attributes and parameters.

microkeras.layers.dense.dense module

class microkeras.layers.dense.dense.Dense(units, activation=None, input_shape=None)[source]

Bases: object

Represents a dense (fully connected) layer in a neural network.

This class implements a dense layer with configurable number of units and activation function.

Attributes: units (int): The number of neurons in the layer. activation (str or None): The activation function to use. input_shape (int or tuple): The shape of the input to this layer.

Methods: build(input_shape): Initialize the layer’s weights and biases. copy(): Create a deep copy of the layer.

build(input_shape)

Build the dense layer by initializing weights and biases.

This method initializes the weight matrix and bias vector for the dense layer based on the input shape and the number of units in the layer.

Parameters: input_shape (int or tuple): The shape of the input to this layer. If tuple, the first element is used.

Note: - Weights are initialized randomly in the range [-0.5, 0.5]. - Biases are initialized randomly in the range [-0.5, 0.5].

copy()

Create a deep copy of the dense layer.

This method creates a new instance of the dense layer with the same configuration and performs a deep copy of the weights and biases if they have been initialized.

Returns: Dense: A new Dense layer instance with copied attributes and parameters.

microkeras.layers.dense.initialize module

microkeras.layers.dense.initialize.initialize(self, units, activation, input_shape)[source]

Initialize the attributes of the dense layer.

This method sets up the basic attributes of the dense layer, including the number of units, activation function, and input shape. It also initializes placeholders for weights, biases, and other attributes that will be set during the build and training process.

Parameters: units (int): The number of neurons in the layer. activation (str or None): The activation function to use. input_shape (int or tuple): The shape of the input to this layer.
